alert.note: Alert for Camden; Maries; Miller; Phelps; Pulaski (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 20 at 11:21AM CDT until July 20 at 1:45PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL CAMDEN, SOUTHERN MARIES, SOUTHERN MILLER, NORTHERN PULASKI AND NORTHERN PHELPS COUNTIES... At 1121 AM CDT, The public reported flash flooding across the warned area. Between 2.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rolla, Osage Beach, Camdenton, St. James, Lake Ozark, Dixon, Crocker, Iberia, Doolittle, Newburg, Sunrise Beach, Linn Creek, Brumley, Swedeborg, Ulman, Brinktown, Wet Glaize, Freedom, Montreal, Kaiser, Jerome, Decaturville, Old Linn Creek, Green Bay Terrace, Hurricane Deck, Roach, Vichy, Northwye, Lake of The Ozarks, Lake of The Ozarks State Park and Ha Ha Tonka State Park. This includes the following low water crossings... Atwell Creek at Highway K, Maries River at County Road 621, Tavern Creek at Highway U, Dry Auglaize Creek at Freedom Ridge Road, Montague Creek at County Road 510, Jones Creek at Highway O and Wet Glaize at Carrol Cave Road. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
